SENT.plain: The authors report the case of a woman with Sturge-Weber syndrome (oculotrigeminate form) presenting with neovascular glaucoma of abrupt onset during pregnancy
Since medical treatment failed, she underwent a retrobulbar alcoholisation
Three months after delivery, enucleation was performed for esthetic reasons
The enucleated eye showed diffuse choroidal angioma, total retinal detachment and a prepapillary glial proliferation
